ygData.subject: RE: What do you think of begging (not the skill)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... *massive snippage of extraneous text* I tend to turn the snubbing of beggars into a role-playing gimmick myself; my cleric launches into a speech (macro d,
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 9 Sep 1999, Chris Wheeler wrote:

> From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>
>
> Well, my final word on the begging issue is that you can choose to ignore,
> but as an RP-ing strategy, I beleive it is perfectly valid. And ignoring and
> beig rude is a perfectly valid response, in terms of RPing.
>
> I didn't want this to turn into an ethical debate. Hell, its only a game.

*massive snippage of extraneous text*

I tend to turn the snubbing of beggars into a role-playing gimmick
myself; my cleric launches into a speech (macro'd, at this point) about
how The Mother of All loves her children, and gives each the
opportunities and chances to earn their success through their own
abilities blahblahblah. Basically ending up saying "Tunare helps those
who can help themselves. Here's a couple of buffs, here's a tarnished
dagger - go get 'em, tiger."

--
We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind
us, with nothing to show for our progress but the memory of the smell
of smoke and the presumption that once our eyes watered.
